meanings.definition: To surpass in charm or attractiveness.
meanings.sent1: The new puppy outcharming the old dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outcharming everyone at the party with her infectious smile.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to outcharming the elegant cat by knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outcharming the darkness in his heart, bringing light to his life.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers in the garden outcharming everything else with their vibrant beauty.

meanings.definition: To be more charming than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The little girl outcharming her brother by giving their parents handmade cards.
meanings.sent2: His witty jokes always manage to outcharming his friends during gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to outcharming the sly raccoon in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outcharming the sound of the rain, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song outcharming all other noises, capturing everyone's attention.
